title: Chicken corn chowder with broccoli terrines

ingredients.content: ¼ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
280 - 320 g canned sweet corn kernels, drained
350 - 400 g skinless chicken breast fillets, cut into pieces (3 cm)
2 tsp Chicken stock paste (refer to The Basic Cookbook)
1 fresh green chilli (e.g. jalapeño), deseeded if preferred and cut into pieces (optional)
2 tbsp fresh coriander, leaves only, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place water in mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position, add broccoli florets to it, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, grease 8 ceramic ramekins (7 cm diameter x 4.5 cm high) with butter. Set Varoma aside and empty mixing bowl.

Place steamed broccoli, eggs, cream, salt, black pepper and nutmeg into mixing bowl and mix <b>1 min/speed 5<b>. Divide mixture evenly between prepared ramekins and arrange them in Varoma dish and tray. Set Varoma aside and clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves and onions into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add corn and sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed <b>, then chop <b>6 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add water and chicken stock paste, place Varoma with broccoli terrines in position, secure Varoma lid and cook <b>27 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep terrines warm.
Add green chilli, cream, salt, cumin and sweet paprika to mixing bowl, mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>, then cook <b>5 min/90°C/speed 1.5<b>.
Serve chicken corn chowder sprinkled with chopped coriander leaves as a starter, followed by broccoli terrines as a main dish (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks:
To keep the broccoli terrines warm while you enjoy the chowder, set the covered Varoma with the broccoli terrines on the empty but still warm mixing bowl.
- Turn out terrines onto a plate for an attractive presentation.
- Broccoli terrines can also be served as a starter or as a side dish with smoked salmon or roasted meat.
- Instead of ceramic ramekins, use glass jars or metal moulds. If using metal moulds, reduce cooking time by 2 minutes in step 7.
